Posts.Content: Feb 27, 2013 04:50PM getonwithlife wrote: Hello,  This is my first post although I have been visiting for months.    My name is Darlene and I am 55 years old.  I was originally diagnosed in Feb 2011 Stage IIB.  I had Masectomy in March, chemo AC and Taxol then 5 weeks of radiation.  Then Tamoxifen, I thought I was all set.   Scheduled DIEP flap for Aug of 2012.  Had MRI as preop test and they found mets in liver (too many to count) and on bones (multiple places).   DIEP flap was canceled and scheduled appt with Oncologist.  I did not know much about Stage 4 Metastatic cancer so I thought I had weeks or at most months left. Fortunately I found this website and started reading the posts.   I realized that many people can live a long time with this horrible disease. I have been on Xeloda and Zometa since October 2012.  CA27.29 counts have been dropping since I started.   CT scan in December showed significant improvement, I will have a new scans the end of this month.    I am on STD, it is very doubtful that I will return to work I would much rather spend my time beating this disease and spending time with my family.    I get nervous everytime I go in for my blood test but so far so good. I have been married to a wonderful man for 34 years and we have a son, daughter in law and daughter.   I have a large extended family and they are all very supportive. I visit this site daily and it is wonderful for me.    It really is true that the only people that truly understand how I feel are the people that are going through the same thing. Thank you all for your posts, they have truly kept me going through all of this.
Posts.Title: Roll Call 2013 LilSchatzie reader123

Posts.Content: Apr 12, 2013 11:18AM getonwithlife wrote: 177 I don't post often but I love the support that I get here.
Posts.Title: How Many Are We? DivineMrsM kt1966
